original_instructions:
First mix cabbage and onions in a large bowl, set aside.
Melt butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Break noodles in small pieces and brown along with sesame seeds and almonds. Cool and drain on paper towels.
To make dressing, mix together all ingredients and microwave to dissolve the sugar. Let cool (about 20 minutes) before serving. Dressing can be made a day ahead of time.
Toss together all salad ingredients and add dressing, just before serving.

step_by_step_instructions: Mix cabbage and onions in a large bowl, set aside.
Melt butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
Break noodles in small pieces and brown along with sesame seeds and almonds.
Cool and drain the browned mixture on paper towels.
To make dressing, mix together vegetable oil, soy sauce, white vinegar, and sugar.
Microwave the dressing to dissolve the sugar and let it cool for about 20 minutes.
Toss together all salad ingredients and add the dressing just before serving.

original_instructions: Place first 8 ingredients in food processor or blender and blend until smooth, then add the pasta water. Toss with hot pasta, adjust seasonings, then serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 clove garlic, cracked away from the skin
1/2 cup evoo -- extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it
1 teaspoon coarse salt, eyeball it in palm of your hand
1 pound spaghetti, cooked to al dente, 1/2 cup pasta water reserved

step_by_step_instructions: Place garlic, ginger root, crushed red pepper flakes, macadamia nuts, lime juice, cilantro leaves, extra-virgin olive oil, and coarse salt in a food processor or blender.
Blend until the mixture is smooth.
Add the reserved pasta water to the blended mixture.
Toss the mixture with hot cooked spaghetti.
Adjust the seasonings to taste.
Serve the dish immediately.

original_instructions: In a cake pan or Dutch oven, melt the butter and sugar together over medium heat until they begin to caramelize. Reduce heat and arrange the quartered peaches in the caramel mix at the bottom of the pan to create a decorative top to the cake and remove from the heat. Mix the cake batter according to package directions. Pour the batter slowly over the peaches and bake according to package directions. Let the cake cool about 30 minutes before unmolding, slicing and serving.
ingredients: 1/4 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
1 box your favorite lemon cake mix

step_by_step_instructions: In a cake pan or Dutch oven, melt the butter and sugar together over medium heat until they begin to caramelize.
Reduce heat and arrange the quartered peaches in the caramel mix at the bottom of the pan to create a decorative top to the cake and remove from the heat.
Mix the cake batter according to package directions.
Pour the batter slowly over the peaches.
Bake according to package directions.
Let the cake cool about 30 minutes before unmolding, slicing and serving.

original_instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and cook until the fat has rendered and the bacon is browned. Add the garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the mustard greens and stir to wilt. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cover and let cook until the greens are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into lardons
1 pound mustard greens (about 1 bunch), tough stems discarded, roughly chopped

step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the bacon and cook until the fat has rendered and the bacon is browned.
Add the garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the mustard greens and stir to wilt.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stir in the chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
Cover and let cook until the greens are tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the lemon juice and serve immediately.

original_instructions: Melt the butter in a large stockpot over moderate heat. Add the onion and saute until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the tomato, garlic, jalapeno and salt and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer. Add the squash and stock and simmer, covered, for about 20 minutes, or until the squash is falling apart and soup is thickened slightly. Puree soup with an immersion blender, or use a blender and return soup to a clean pan. Add the milk and heat gently. Stir in the cheese and adjust the seasonings.
ingredients: 1 medium tomato, cored, seeded and diced
2 jalapeno chiles, stemmed, seeded and chopped
1 1/2 pounds winter squash, such as West Indian pumpkin, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes

step_by_step_instructions: Melt the butter in a large stockpot over moderate heat.
Add the onion and saute until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomato, garlic, jalapeno and salt and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer.
Add the squash and stock and simmer, covered, for about 20 minutes, or until the squash is falling apart and soup is thickened slightly.
Puree soup with an immersion blender, or use a blender and return soup to a clean pan.
Add the milk and heat gently.
Stir in the cheese and adjust the seasonings.

original_instructions:
In a large stockpot or Dutch oven, heat oil. Add onions and saute for 2 to 3 minutes on high until fragrant and tender.
In a large bowl, mix salt, pepper, flour, onion powder, and garlic powder together. Add meat to seasoned flour. Dredge to coat and add flour and meat to pot with onions. Cook until meat is lightly browned, stirring frequently for about 8 to 10 minutes.
Add water and beef bouillon to pot and continue to cook and stir on high until soup begins to thicken. Bring to a boil. Turn heat off and add cheese. Cover the pot with a lid and allow the cheese to sit and melt.
Pour into bread bowls and garnish with chives and parsley.
ingredients: 2 1/2 pounds beef tenderloin, sliced lengthwise and cubed
Bread bowls, hollowed out, for serving

step_by_step_instructions: Heat oil in a large stockpot or Dutch oven.
Add diced onions and saute on high for 2 to 3 minutes until fragrant and tender.
In a large bowl, mix salt, pepper, flour, onion powder, and garlic powder together.
Add beef to the seasoned flour and dredge to coat.
Add flour and beef to the pot with onions and cook until the beef is lightly browned, stirring frequently for 8 to 10 minutes.
Add water and beef bouillon to the pot and continue to cook and stir on high.
Bring the soup to a boil.
Turn off the heat and add cheese, cover the pot with a lid and allow the cheese to melt.
Pour the soup into hollowed-out bread bowls.
Garnish with chives and parsley.

original_instructions: Whisk together the sugar, water, fish sauce, and lime juice in a bowl until the sugar is completely dissolved. Add the garlic, chile, and shallot, and let stand for 30 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 1 or more bird's eye or Thai chiles, seeded and minced
1 shallot, peeled, thinly sliced, and rinsed (optional)

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together the sugar, water, fish sauce, and lime juice in a bowl until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Add the minced garlic, minced chile, and thinly sliced shallot to the bowl.
Let the mixture stand for 30 minutes before serving.

original_instructions: Combine whipping cream, chocolate milk, syrup, evaporated and sweetened condensed milk in a large bowl. Mix well. Chill for 4 to 6 hours. Pour into ice cream freezer. Follow your freezer directions. When ice cream begins to set, add shavings if desired. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 cup bittersweet chocolate shavings, chopped fine (optional)

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the heavy whipping cream, chocolate milk, chocolate syrup, evaporated milk, and sweetened condensed milk in a large bowl.
Mix the ingredients well.
Chill the mixture for 4 to 6 hours.
Pour the chilled mixture into an ice cream freezer.
Follow your freezer's directions to churn the ice cream.
When the ice cream begins to set, add chocolate shavings if desired.
Serve the ice cream immediately.

original_instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add extra-virgin olive oil and butter. Add mushrooms and season with salt, pepper and thyme then cook 15 minutes until evenly browned and tender. Add wine and deglaze the pan. Add parsley and transfer mushrooms to a serving dish.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, 1 turn of the pan
1 1/2 pounds crimini mushrooms, brushed clean with damp towel

step_by_step_instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium high heat.
Add extra-virgin olive oil and butter to the skillet.
Add mushrooms to the skillet and season with salt, pepper, and thyme.
Cook the mushrooms for 15 minutes until they are evenly browned and tender.
Add wine to the skillet and deglaze the pan.
Add parsley and transfer mushrooms to a serving dish.

recipe_title: Shrimp Cakes with Peach Jalapeno Relish
original_instructions:
In a food processor, pulse shrimp. Place into a large bowl. Pulse corn, pepper, onion and jalapeno. Remove and drain through a sieve to get rid of extra water that the vegetables may release. Add to bowl along with 1 cup bread crumbs, hot sauce, chili powder and eggs. Stir well together. Form into cakes about 1-inch thick. Place in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to firm up.
Heat a large skillet with vegetable oil over medium heat.
In a shallow dish, add the remaining 1 cup of panko; add salt and pepper. Bread the cakes in the panko. Add the cakes in batches to the oil, cooking about 4 minutes per side. Remove to a paper towel lined sheet tray. Serve with relish.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Chill until ready to serve.
ingredients: 1 pound large peeled, deveined cooked shrimp, diced
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a food processor, pulse shrimp.
Place shrimp into a large bowl.
Pulse corn, pepper, onion and jalapeno.
Remove vegetables and drain through a sieve to get rid of extra water.
Add vegetables to the bowl with shrimp.
Add 1 cup bread crumbs, hot sauce, chili powder, and eggs to the bowl.
Stir the mixture well.
Form the mixture into cakes about 1-inch thick.
Place the cakes in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to firm up.
Heat a large skillet with vegetable oil over medium heat.
In a shallow dish, add the remaining 1 cup of panko, salt, and pepper.
Bread the cakes in the panko mixture.
Add the cakes in batches to the skillet, cooking about 4 minutes per side.
Remove cakes to a paper towel-lined sheet tray.
Serve the cakes with peach jalapeno relish.
Combine peaches, red onion, jalapeno, lime juice, sugar, salt, and black pepper in a small bowl.
Chill the relish until ready to serve.

recipe_title: Arugula Salad with Carrot and Yellow Pepper
original_instructions:
In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar and salt and black pepper to taste, add the oil in a stream, whisking, and whisk the dressing until it is emulsified. In a large bowl combine the lettuce, the arugula, the carrot, and the bell pepper, drizzle the dressing over the salad, and toss the salad until it is combined well.
In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar and salt and black pepper to taste, add the oil in a stream, whisking, and whisk the dressing until it is emulsified. In a large bowl combine the lettuce, the arugula, the carrot, and the bell pepper, drizzle the dressing over the salad, and toss the salad until it is combined well.
ingredients: 10 cups loosely packed bite-size pieces of leaf lettuce, rinsed and spun dry
3 cups arugula, course stems discarded and the leaves rinsed and spun dry
1/2 cup julienne strips of yellow bell pepper

step_by_step_instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, salt, and black pepper to taste.
Add the olive oil in a stream while whisking, and continue to whisk until the dressing is emulsified.
In a large bowl, combine the leaf lettuce, arugula, carrot, and yellow bell pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad.
Toss the salad until it is well combined.

original_instructions:
Place about 10 ice cubes in a plastic bag with a zipper-like closure. With a mallet, a rolling pin or the handle of a large knife, crack the ice into coarse pieces. Transfer them to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse until ice is finely shaved, but not powdery. Transfer it to a chilled bowl. Working with your hands, gently gather ice shavings and shape into a 2 to 4-inch ball, depending on size of serving glass. Do not pack the ice too tightly. Place ball in a chilled glass.
Fill a cocktail shaker one-third of the way up with crushed ice. Add vodka, orange liqueur, lime juice and cranberry juice. Shake well and strain liquid over the snowball. Garnish with the lemon or lime twist and serve with a small cocktail straw.
ingredients: Lemon or lime twist for garnish

step_by_step_instructions: Place about 10 ice cubes in a plastic bag with a zipper-like closure.
With a mallet, a rolling pin or the handle of a large knife, crack the ice into coarse pieces.
Transfer them to the bowl of a food processor.
Pulse until ice is finely shaved, but not powdery.
Transfer it to a chilled bowl.
Working with your hands, gently gather ice shavings and shape into a 2 to 4-inch ball, depending on size of serving glass.
Do not pack the ice too tightly.
Place ball in a chilled glass.
Fill a cocktail shaker one-third of the way up with crushed ice.
Add vodka, orange liqueur, lime juice and cranberry juice.
Shake well and strain liquid over the snowball.
Garnish with the lemon twist and serve with a small cocktail straw.

original_instructions:
In a saucepan, heat the extra-virgin olive oil. Add the garlic, celery, carrot, and onion and saute until they are soft. Add the tripe, and cook together on medium heat, for about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes including the juices. Break up the whole plum tomatoes with a fork.
Let the mixture cook together until the sauce has reduced and thickened, about 15 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat, season with salt and pepper, to taste, and add the freshly grated Parmigiano cheese. Stir well and serve warm.
ingredients: 2 pounds tripe, cleaned, boiled* and cut into strips
1 (10 ounce) can peeled plum tomatoes, with juices
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 cup freshly grated Parmigiano Reggiano cheese

step_by_step_instructions: Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a saucepan.
Add the garlic, celery, carrot, and onion and saute until they are soft.
Add the tripe and cook together on medium heat for about 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes including the juices.
Break up the whole plum tomatoes with a fork.
Let the mixture cook together until the sauce has reduced and thickened, about 15 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat, season with salt and pepper to taste.
Add the freshly grated Parmigiano cheese, stir well.
Serve warm.

original_instructions:
In a food processor blend together all filling ingredients except water until an almost smooth, jamlike consistency. If date mixture is very dry blend in water, 1 tablespoon at a time. Filling may be made 2 days ahead and chilled, covered.
In a food processor blend together all filling ingredients except water until an almost smooth, jamlike consistency. If date mixture is very dry blend in water, 1 tablespoon at a time. Filling may be made 2 days ahead and chilled, covered.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon packed finely grated fresh orange zest

step_by_step_instructions: Place all filling ingredients except water into a food processor.
Blend the mixture until it reaches an almost smooth, jamlike consistency.
If the mixture is very dry, blend in water, adding 1 tablespoon at a time.
Filling can be made 2 days ahead and stored in the refrigerator, covered.

recipe_title: Shortcakes with Chantilly Cream and Passion Fruit Basil Syrup
original_instructions:
Place the sugar and 1/2 cup water in a small pot and bring to a boil. Once the sugar has dissolved, remove from the heat and add the basil stems. Allow the basil to infuse the simple syrup for approximately half an hour.
Remove the basil stems and strain the basil syrup into a bowl. Add the passion fruit pulp to the syrup, stir to incorporate and set aside.
In a chilled metal bowl, place the whipping cream, cream cheese, vanilla and sugar. Whip until medium-soft peaks form.
To assemble, place a shortcake on a serving plate. Spoon the passion fruit basil syrup over and around the cake. Dollop the chantilly cream on the cake and garnish with a reserved basil leaf.
ingredients: 1/2 cup basil stems with leaves, plus 4 leaves for garnish
4 store-bought mini shortcakes or sponge cakes

step_by_step_instructions: Place the sugar and 1/2 cup water in a small pot and bring to a boil.
Once the sugar has dissolved, remove from the heat and add the basil stems.
Allow the basil to infuse the simple syrup for approximately half an hour.
Remove the basil stems and strain the basil syrup into a bowl.
Add the passion fruit pulp to the syrup, stir to incorporate and set aside.
In a chilled metal bowl, place the whipping cream, cream cheese, vanilla and sugar.
Whip until medium-soft peaks form.
To assemble, place a shortcake on a serving plate.
Spoon the passion fruit basil syrup over and around the cake.
Dollop the chantilly cream on the cake and garnish with a reserved basil leaf.

recipe_title: Leg of Lamb Poached in White Wine Court Bouillon
original_instructions:
Pique the boned and tied leg of lamb with slivers of garlic (cut small gashes and insert garlic) and rub it will with dried rosemary. Put wine, and equal amount of water, vegetables, and seasonings in a large kettle, bring to a boil and simmer for 25 minutes. Add lamb and bring liquid to a boil again. Cover the pan, reduce heat and simmer, allowing 15 minutes per pound of meat. Serve with Sauce Soubise. With this, drink chilled Pouilly Fuissé.
Pique the boned and tied leg of lamb with slivers of garlic (cut small gashes and insert garlic) and rub it will with dried rosemary. Put wine, and equal amount of water, vegetables, and seasonings in a large kettle, bring to a boil and simmer for 25 minutes. Add lamb and bring liquid to a boil again. Cover the pan, reduce heat and simmer, allowing 15 minutes per pound of meat. Serve with Sauce Soubise. With this, drink chilled Pouilly Fuissé.
ingredients: 1 small leg of lamb, boned and tied

step_by_step_instructions: Pique the boned and tied leg of lamb with slivers of garlic by cutting small gashes and inserting garlic.
Rub the lamb well with dried rosemary.
Put white wine, an equal amount of water, onions stuck with cloves, carrot, celery, salt, and black pepper in a large kettle.
Bring the mixture to a boil and simmer for 25 minutes.
Add the lamb to the kettle and bring the liquid to a boil again.
Cover the pan, reduce the heat, and simmer, allowing 15 minutes per pound of meat.
Serve with Sauce Soubise.

original_instructions:
Pulse butter and marmalade in a food processor until combined well. Transfer to a small crock or serving bowl.
Pulse butter and marmalade in a food processor until combined well. Transfer to a small crock or serving bowl.
ingredients: 1 stick (1/2 cup) salted or unsalted butter, softened

step_by_step_instructions: Pulse butter and marmalade in a food processor until combined well.
Transfer to a small crock or serving bowl.

original_instructions: Combine ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Transfer mixture to a sealed container. This rub can be stored in the freezer for several months.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chipotle chili powder (can substitute with 2 teaspoons cayenne pepper and 1 teaspoon hickory smoke salt)

step_by_step_instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
Mix the ingredients well until evenly combined.
Transfer the mixture to a sealed container for storage.

original_instructions:
Slice about 1-inch from the bottom of the asparagus stalks. Place stalks in a jar of water to rehydrate for several hours.
Cover an outdoor grill with aluminum foil. Preheat grill to high heat.
In a large bowl, toss asparagus with thyme and olive oil until all the asparagus is coated. Season with salt and pepper.
Place asparagus on the foil-covered grill and cook until tender, rotating frequently to avoid scorching, about 6 to 7 minutes. Place asparagus on a platter and sprinkle with the feta.
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Slice about 1-inch from the bottom of the asparagus stalks.
Place stalks in a jar of water to rehydrate for several hours.
Cover an outdoor grill with aluminum foil.
Preheat grill to high heat.
In a large bowl, toss asparagus with thyme and olive oil until all the asparagus is coated.
Season the asparagus with salt and pepper.
Place asparagus on the foil-covered grill and cook until tender, rotating frequently to avoid scorching, about 6 to 7 minutes.
Place asparagus on a platter and sprinkle with the feta.

recipe_title: Roasted Duck in Fermented Bean Curd: Vit Nuong Chao
original_instructions: For the marinade: Combine the white bean curd, sugar, red fermented bean curd, ginger, bean curd water, and oil and mix well. Coat the duck with marinade and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight. Heat a charcoal grill to medium heat. Roast and rotate the duck over charcoal for 20 minutes.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine white bean curd, sugar, red fermented bean curd, ginger, bean curd water, and sesame oil in a bowl and mix well.
Coat the duck with the marinade.
Marinate the duck in the refrigerator for 2 hours or overnight.
Heat a charcoal grill to medium heat.
Roast and rotate the duck over charcoal for 20 minutes.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and butter and flour a 9-inch square baking pan, knocking out excess flour.
In a metal bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water melt chocolates and butter, stirring, and remove bowl from heat. Cool chocolate mixture.
In a large bowl whisk together sugar, eggs, and vanilla until smooth and whisk in chocolate mixture. Add flour and salt and stir until combined well. Stir in walnuts and spread batter in prepared pan. Smooth top and bake in middle of oven 30 to 40 minutes, or until a tester comes out with crumbs adhering. Cool brownies in pan on a rack and cut into 3-inch squares.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Butter and flour a 9-inch square baking pan, knocking out the excess flour.
In a metal bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water, melt the chocolates and butter, stirring occasionally.
Remove the bowl from heat and cool the chocolate mixture.
In a large bowl, whisk together sugar, eggs, and vanilla until smooth.
Whisk in the cooled chocolate mixture.
Add flour and salt and stir until combined well.
Stir in walnuts.
Spread batter in the prepared pan and smooth the top.
Bake in the middle of the oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until a tester comes out with crumbs adhering.
Cool brownies in pan on a rack.
Cut into 3-inch squares.

original_instructions:
Preheat a grill to medium-high.
Season the wings with Cajun pepper. In a medium bowl, combine the chipotle pepper sauce with 1 tablespoon Cajun pepper, and honey, to taste. Place the wings on the grill and as you cook them, turn them and brush each time with the pepper sauce mixture. Make sure the wings cook long enough on each side so they get crispy around the edges.
Remove the wings from the grill and brush again with the pepper sauce mixture before serving.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Cajun pepper, plus more for seasoning wings

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill to medium-high.
Season the wings with Cajun pepper.
In a medium bowl, combine the chipotle pepper sauce with 1 tablespoon Cajun pepper, and honey, to taste.
Place the wings on the grill and as you cook them, turn them and brush each time with the pepper sauce mixture.
Make sure the wings cook long enough on each side so they get crispy around the edges.
Remove the wings from the grill and brush again with the pepper sauce mixture before serving.

original_instructions:
Heat a griddle over high heat. Sear the lemon slices on each side until they become slightly caramelized. Set aside. When ready to serve, chop the beef filet as finely as possible by hand using a sharp knife. Form the chopped meat into loose balls, about 1 ounce each.
Place the seared lemons on a plate and top with the filet tartare balls. Serve immediately with lemon zest and sea salt as accompaniments.
ingredients: 7 lemons, sliced 1/4 inch thick (about 48 slices), plus zest of 6 lemons

step_by_step_instructions: Heat a griddle over high heat.
Sear the lemon slices on each side until they become slightly caramelized.
Set the lemons aside.
When ready to serve, chop the beef filet as finely as possible by hand using a sharp knife.
Form the chopped meat into loose balls, about 1 ounce each.
Place the seared lemons on a plate and top with the filet tartare balls.
Serve immediately with lemon zest and salt as accompaniments.

original_instructions: Place a very large nonstick skillet over low heat. Add the oil and garlic clove into the skillet and gently infuse the garlic flavor into the oil. In the meantime, using a round cookie cutter or an empty can, cut out the center of all 6 slices of bread. Add the prepared bread slices to the garlic infused oil. Crack the eggs 1 at a time and drop them into their "nests" or, the center of each slice of bread. Drain and slice red pepper. Add a strip or 2 of red pepper to each nest. Season the birds in their nests with salt and pepper and sprinkle a little cheese into each nest. Gently turn the birds in their nests and turn off the heat. Let the eggs sit in their nests 5 minutes more, then transfer to a platter and serve.
ingredients: 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it
6 big, thick slices crusty Italian semolina bread
1/2 cup grated cheese, Parmesan or Romano

step_by_step_instructions: Place a very large nonstick skillet over low heat.
Add the oil and garlic clove into the skillet and gently infuse the garlic flavor into the oil.
Using a round cookie cutter or an empty can, cut out the center of all 6 slices of bread.
Add the prepared bread slices to the garlic infused oil in the skillet.
Crack the eggs one at a time and drop them into the center of each slice of bread.
Drain and slice the red pepper.
Add a strip or two of red pepper to each nest.
Season each nest with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle a little cheese into each nest.
Gently turn the bread with eggs in their nests and turn off the heat.
Let the eggs sit in their nests for 5 more minutes.
Transfer the nests to a platter and serve.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Beat the egg whites and cream of tartar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until frothy. Beat in the sugar; increase the mixer speed to high and beat until stiff peaks form, 5 to 6 minutes.
Transfer to a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip. Pipe 8 to 10 swirls on the prepared baking sheet. Bake until dry, 1 hour to 1 hour, 15 minutes. Transfer the baking sheet to a rack and let cool completely.
Put the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl; microwave on 50 percent power until melted, about 1 minute, stirring halfway. Transfer the melted chocolate to a zip-top bag and snip a corner. Pipe the chocolate on the meringues to look like eyes.
Photograph by Raymond Hom

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Beat the egg whites and cream of tartar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium speed until frothy.
Beat in the sugar; increase the mixer speed to high and beat until stiff peaks form, 5 to 6 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a pastry bag fitted with a large round tip.
Pipe 8 to 10 swirls on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until dry, 1 hour to 1 hour, 15 minutes.
Transfer the baking sheet to a rack and let cool completely.
Put the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl; microwave on 50 percent power until melted, about 1 minute, stirring halfway.
Transfer the melted chocolate to a zip-top bag and snip a corner.
Pipe the chocolate on the meringues to look like eyes.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: an instant-read thermometer
Combine the rosemary, cumin, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, oregano, lime juice, hoisin sauce, beer, salt and pepper in a blender and blend until completely combined. Pour the marinade over the chicken in a container and let it marinate, refrigerated, for 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Remove the chicken from the marinade (discard the marinade) and put on a rack in a roasting pan. Roast until the internal temperature registers 165 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer, about 1 hour. Let the chicken rest for 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine rosemary, cumin, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, oregano, lime juice, hoisin sauce, beer, salt, and pepper in a blender.
Blend until completely combined.
Pour the marinade over the chicken in a container.
Refrigerate and marinate the chicken for 24 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade.
Place the chicken on a rack in a roasting pan.
Roast the chicken until the internal temperature registers 165 degrees F, about 1 hour.
Let the chicken rest for 15 minutes before slicing and serving.

original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook chopped broccoli then set aside. Melt butter in saucepan, stir in flour and cook over high heat for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add milk, whisk vigorously. Return to heat, stirring until thick and smooth, continue to stir while adding cheese and spices. Remove from heat and add beaten egg yolks little by little -- do not boil or mixture will curdle. Add drained broccoli and set the mixture aside. Beat the cream of tartar with the egg whites with until they are stiff. Fold in 1/3 of the whites to the broccoli mixture. Fold in the remaining egg whites.
Pour mixture into an 8 cup buttered souffle dish and bake in the preheated 350 degree oven for 45 minutes.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Cook chopped broccoli and set aside.
Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour and cook over high heat for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat. Add milk, whisk vigorously.
Return to heat and stir until thick and smooth, continue to stir while adding cheese and spices.
Remove from heat and add beaten egg yolks little by little -- do not boil or the mixture will curdle.
Add drained broccoli and set the mixture aside.
Beat the cream of tartar with the egg whites until they are stiff.
Fold in 1/3 of the egg whites into the broccoli mixture.
Fold in the remaining egg whites.
Pour mixture into an 8 cup buttered souffle dish.
Bake in the preheated 350 degree oven for 45 minutes.

original_instructions:
Toss flour and chicken in bag to coat. Cook chicken in oil in nonstick skillet 6 minutes, until browned, turning once. Transfer to plate.
Cook onion in skillet 7 minutes. Add garlic, cinnamon, ginger, cumin, cayenne; cook 1 minute. Stir in tomato, honey and salt. Add chicken; simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Stir in peppers, raisins and chickpeas; simmer, stirring, 15 minutes, until peppers are tender and chicken is no longer pink near the bone.
Serve over orzo. Sprinkle with almonds and parsley.
ingredients: 2 red onions, quartered lengthwise, sliced crosswise
2 sweet green peppers, cut in 1/2-inch squares
1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained

step_by_step_instructions: Toss flour and chicken in a bag to coat.
Cook chicken in oil in a nonstick skillet for 6 minutes until browned, turning once.
Transfer chicken to a plate.
Cook onion in the skillet for 7 minutes.
Add garlic, cinnamon, ginger, cumin, and cayenne; cook for 1 minute.
Stir in tomato puree, honey, and salt.
Add chicken back to the skillet; simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.
Stir in peppers, raisins, and chickpeas; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes until peppers are tender and chicken is no longer pink near the bone.
Serve over cooked orzo.
Sprinkle with almonds and parsley before serving.

original_instructions: Pour 1 gallon water into a large pot. Add the meat and stir with a spoon to break it up and combine with the water. Put the pot over low heat and cook for 5 hours. Remove the excess water and grease during the cooking process. At the end of the cooking time, add the onion, chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic, black pepper, red pepper and salt to taste. Add the beans and tomato sauce to a large serving bowl and stir in the cooked chili.

step_by_step_instructions: Pour 1 gallon water into a large pot.
Add the meat and stir with a spoon to break it up and combine with the water.
Put the pot over low heat and cook for 5 hours.
Remove the excess water and grease during the cooking process.
At the end of the cooking time, add the onion, chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic, black pepper, red pepper, and salt to taste.
Add the beans and tomato sauce to a large serving bowl.
Stir in the cooked chili.

recipe_title: Grilled Corn and Chipotle Pepper Salad
original_instructions:
Preheat the grill to medium.
Arrange the corn on the grill and cook, turning frequently, until the corn is slightly charred, about 12 to 15 minutes
Remove the corn from the grill to a cutting board and let cool. Cut the kernels from the cobs with a sharp knife and transfer to a serving bowl. Add all the remaining ingredients and toss to combine.
ingredients: 8 ears fresh corn, husks and silk removed

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the grill to medium.
Arrange the corn on the grill and cook, turning frequently, until the corn is slightly charred, about 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove the corn from the grill to a cutting board and let cool.
Cut the kernels from the cobs with a sharp knife and transfer to a serving bowl.
Add the red bell pepper, red onion, green onion, chipotle peppers, cilantro leaves, olive oil, minced garlic, lime juice, salt, and black pepper to the bowl.
Toss to combine all the ingredients.

original_instructions:
Preheat broiler. Place tomatoes cut side up in baking dish. Spread garlic over cut half of tomatoes. Sprinkle tomatoes with oregano then Romano. Season with pepper. Broil until tomatoes are tender, about 5 minutes. Serve.
Preheat broiler. Place tomatoes cut side up in baking dish. Spread garlic over cut half of tomatoes. Sprinkle tomatoes with oregano then Romano. Season with pepper. Broil until tomatoes are tender, about 5 minutes. Serve.
ingredients: 8 plum tomatoes, cut in half lengthwise
1 tablespoon minced fresh oregano or 1 teaspoon dried, crumbled

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat broiler.
Place tomatoes cut side up in baking dish.
Spread garlic over cut half of tomatoes.
Sprinkle tomatoes with oregano.
Sprinkle tomatoes with Romano.
Season with pepper.
Broil until tomatoes are tender, about 5 minutes.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
At least 1 hour before you plan to serve the salad, whisk together the olive oil, lemon zest, 1/4 cup of lemon juice, the shallots, celery seed, celery salt, anchovy paste, 2 teaspoons salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper. Place the celery in a mixing bowl and toss it with the remaining 1 tablespoon of lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. (Even though these ingredients are in the dressing, believe me-this step makes a difference.) Add enough dressing to moisten well. Cover and refrigerate for at least an hour to allow the celery to crisp and the flavors to develop.
When ready to serve, arrange the celery on a platter, shave the Parmesan onto the celery with a vegetable peeler, then sprinkle with walnuts, parsley leaves, salt, and pepper and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice (3 lemons)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
5 cups thinly sliced celery hearts, tender leaves included, sliced on an angle (about 12 stalks)

step_by_step_instructions: Whisk together the olive oil, lemon zest, 1/4 cup lemon juice, shallots, celery seed, celery salt, anchovy paste, 2 teaspoons salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper to make the dressing.
Place the celery in a mixing bowl and toss with 1 tablespoon lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Add enough dressing to moisten the celery well.
Cover and refrigerate the celery for at least an hour.
Arrange the celery on a platter.
Shave the Parmesan cheese onto the celery using a vegetable peeler.
Sprinkle with walnuts, parsley leaves, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: Divide Bibb lettuce leaves between 4 salad plates. Cover with thinly-sliced radishes, drizzle with olive oil and aged red wine vinegar, and sprinkle with blue cheese.

step_by_step_instructions: Divide Bibb lettuce leaves between 4 salad plates.
Cover with thinly-sliced radishes.
Drizzle with olive oil.
Drizzle with aged red wine vinegar.
Sprinkle with blue cheese.

original_instructions:
In the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade, process the flour sugar, cinnamon and salt. Add the frozen butter and process until it is the size of large peas, about 5 seconds. Add the frozen shortening and process for 3 seconds. In a measuring cup, combine the egg and the water. Add egg mixture and process for 5 seconds. Empty the dough onto a counter and incorporate Remaining flour without overworking the dough. Let rest 2 hours.
In small bowl, combine sugar, salt and spices. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Stir in pumpkin and evaporated milk. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350 and bake for 45 minutes or until firm.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons frozen butter, cut in pieces
1/4 cup vegetable shortening, frozen in pieces

step_by_step_instructions: In the bowl of a food processor fitted with the steel blade, process the flour, sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
Add the frozen butter and process until it is the size of large peas, about 5 seconds.
Add the frozen shortening and process for 3 seconds.
In a measuring cup, combine the egg and the water.
Add the egg mixture to the food processor and process for 5 seconds.
Empty the dough onto a counter and incorporate the remaining flour without overworking the dough.
Let the dough rest for 2 hours.
In a small bowl, combine the sugar, salt, and spices.
Beat eggs in a large bowl.
Stir in the pumpkin and evaporated milk.
Pour the mixture into the pie shell.
Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes.
Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees and bake for 45 minutes or until firm.

original_instructions:
Preheat a grill to medium high. Soak 8 wooden skewers in water, about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, make the dressing: Mix the olive oil, vinegar, oregano, shallot, garlic, red pepper flakes and 1 1/4 teaspoons salt in a large bowl. Drizzle the cut sides of each piece of romaine with about 1 teaspoon of the dressing. Add the chicken to the bowl with the remaining dressing and toss. Add the breadcrumbs and toss to coat. Thread the chicken onto the skewers, leaving space between each piece. Grill the chicken skewers, turning occasionally, until cooked through, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, grill the romaine, turning once, until marked and slightly wilted, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer the romaine to plates and drizzle with olive oil and vinegar. Season with salt. Serve with the chicken skewers and sprinkle with the parmesan.
Photograph by Antonis Achilleos
ingredients: 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
2 teaspoons red wine vinegar, plus more for drizzling
1 tablespoon minced shallot or red onion
1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into chunks

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat a grill to medium high.
Soak 8 wooden skewers in water for about 15 minutes.
Mix olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, shallot, garlic, red pepper flakes, and salt in a large bowl to make the dressing.
Drizzle the cut sides of each piece of romaine lettuce with about 1 teaspoon of the dressing.
Add the chicken to the bowl with the remaining dressing and toss to coat.
Add breadcrumbs to the bowl and toss to coat the chicken.
Thread the chicken onto the skewers, leaving space between each piece.
Grill the chicken skewers, turning occasionally, until cooked through, for 8 to 10 minutes.
Grill the romaine lettuce, turning once, until marked and slightly wilted, for 1 to 2 minutes.
Transfer the grilled romaine to plates and drizzle with olive oil and vinegar.
Season the grilled romaine with salt.
Serve the grilled chicken skewers with the romaine and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

recipe_title: Sweet Roasted Rosemary Acorn Squash Wedges
original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the acorn squash in half from top to bottom using a sharp knife. Use a spoon to scrape out the stuff inside. Cut each half into 4 equal wedges, and then place the wedges, skin-side down, in a baking dish. Sprinkle lightly with salt.
Combine the butter, brown sugar, salt, rosemary and chili powder in a bowl and mix into a paste. Smear the paste all over the squash.
Roast in the oven for 20 minutes. Then baste with the butter mixture from the bottom of the pan and return to the oven for another 20 minutes.
Serve in the baking dish, drizzling more sauce at the end. Yummy!

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut the acorn squash in half from top to bottom using a sharp knife.
Use a spoon to scrape out the stuff inside.
Cut each half into 4 equal wedges.
Place the wedges, skin-side down, in a baking dish.
Sprinkle lightly with salt.
Combine butter, brown sugar, salt, rosemary, and chili powder in a bowl.
Mix into a paste.
Smear the paste all over the squash.
Roast in the oven for 20 minutes.
Baste with the butter mixture from the bottom of the pan.
Return to the oven for another 20 minutes.
Serve in the baking dish, drizzling more sauce at the end.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Scatter the thyme leaves among the compartments of 2 large ice cube trays. Fill the trays with ginger beer and freeze at least 6 hours and preferably overnight.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Put the pineapple slices on a nonstick baking sheet. Brush both sides very lightly with vegetable oil and sprinkle them evenly with the sugar; sprinkle very lightly with salt as well. Roast in the oven for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and flip the slices.
Put in the oven and continue roasting until they are golden, about 10 minutes more. Remove from oven and cool slightly in the pan.
Transfer the ginger beer ice cubes to a food processor and pulse until broken down and fluffy. Transfer to a small cake pan or baking dish.
To serve, put 2 slices of warm pineapple on each dessert plate; top with a scoop of ginger ice and garnish with a small sprig of thyme.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon thyme leaves, plus small sprigs for garnish
2 bottles, 12 ounces each, ginger beer or all-natural ginger soda
1 whole pineapple, peeled, eyes removed, and sliced into 8 even slices

step_by_step_instructions: Scatter the thyme leaves among the compartments of 2 large ice cube trays.
Fill the trays with ginger beer and freeze for at least 6 hours, preferably overnight.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Put the pineapple slices on a nonstick baking sheet.
Brush both sides of the pineapple slices very lightly with vegetable oil.
Sprinkle the pineapple slices evenly with sugar and very lightly with salt.
Roast in the oven for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and flip the pineapple slices.
Put the pineapple slices back in the oven and continue roasting until golden, about 10 minutes more.
Remove from the oven and cool slightly in the pan.
Transfer the ginger beer ice cubes to a food processor and pulse until broken down and fluffy.
Transfer the processed ginger ice to a small cake pan or baking dish.
To serve, put 2 slices of warm pineapple on each dessert plate, top with a scoop of ginger ice, and garnish with a small sprig of thyme.

original_instructions: In a small pitcher combined all ingredient and stir together. Pour into a rocks glass filled with ice.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine all ingredients in a small pitcher.
Stir the mixture together.
Pour the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.

original_instructions: Combine the sugar, butter and cinnamon in a flambe pan or skillet. Place the pan over low heat either on an alcohol burner or on top of the stove and cook, stirring, until the sugar dissolves. Stir in the banana liqueur and then place the bananas in the pan. When the banana sections soften and begin to brown, carefully add the rum. Continue to cook the sauce until the rum is hot and then tip the pan slightly to ignite the rum. When the flames subside, lift the bananas out of the pan and place four pieces over each portion of ice cream. Generously spoon warm sauce over the top of the ice cream and serve immediately.
ingredients: 4 bananas, cut in half lengthwise then halved

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the sugar, butter, and cinnamon in a flambe pan or skillet.
Place the pan over low heat either on an alcohol burner or on top of the stove.
Cook, stirring, until the sugar dissolves.
Stir in the banana liqueur.
Place the bananas in the pan.
When the banana sections soften and begin to brown, carefully add the rum.
Continue to cook the sauce until the rum is hot and then tip the pan slightly to ignite the rum.
When the flames subside, lift the bananas out of the pan and place four pieces over each portion of ice cream.
Generously spoon warm sauce over the top of the ice cream and serve immediately.

recipe_title: Orange-Scented Almond Cookies: Amygdalota me Orange
original_instructions:
Grind the almonds in a food processor until ground fine. Add in 2 1/2 cups of sugar. Put the almond mixture into a small saucepan on medium high heat. Add in the liquids and simmer until sugar is dissolved. Put aside to cool.
Once cool, shape tablespoon-sized portions of the mixture into 1 1/2-inch-high pear shapes, wetting your fingers with the juice. Dredge each cookie in confectioners or granulated sugar to coat. Wrap individually in cellophane or place in a box with a lid. Let stand for at least 3 days before serving.
ingredients: 1/4 cup orange juice, plus more, for shaping

step_by_step_instructions: Grind the almonds in a food processor until ground fine.
Add in 2 1/2 cups of sugar.
Put the almond mixture into a small saucepan on medium high heat.
Add in the liquids and simmer until sugar is dissolved.
Put aside to cool.
Once cool, shape tablespoon-sized portions of the mixture into 1 1/2-inch-high pear shapes, wetting your fingers with the juice.
Dredge each cookie in granulated sugar to coat.
Wrap individually in cellophane or place in a box with a lid.
Let stand for at least 3 days before serving.

recipe_title: Sauteed Carrots with Red Bell Pepper and Dill
original_instructions:
Melt butter in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots and sauté until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add bell pepper and water. Cover and cook until vegetables are tender, 5 minutes. Add dill. Season with salt and pepper.
Melt butter in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots and sauté until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add bell pepper and water. Cover and cook until vegetables are tender, 5 minutes. Add dill. Season with salt and pepper.

step_by_step_instructions: Melt butter in a heavy large skillet over medium heat.
Add carrots and sauté until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes.
Add bell pepper and water.
Cover and cook until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add dill.
Season with salt and pepper.

recipe_title: Grilled Cheese With Bacon and Thousand Island Dressing
original_instructions:
Cook the bacon in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 8 minutes. Remove and drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Wipe out the skillet.
Heat the butter in the skillet over medium heat. Add 2 bread slices. Top each with one-quarter of the cheese and 2 strips bacon. Spread 2 bread slices with some of the dressing and press them on top of the sandwiches, dressing-side down. Cook until the cheese melts and the bread is golden, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Repeat to make 2 more sandwiches, adding more butter as needed.
Photograph by Andrew Mccaul
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more as needed
12 ounces cotswold cheese (double Gloucester with chives) or cheddar, shredded

step_by_step_instructions: Cook the bacon in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 8 minutes.
Remove the bacon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
Wipe out the skillet.
Heat the butter in the skillet over medium heat.
Add 2 bread slices to the skillet.
Top each slice with one-quarter of the cheese and 2 strips of bacon.
Spread 2 more bread slices with some of the dressing.
Press them on top of the sandwiches, dressing-side down.
Cook until the cheese melts and the bread is golden, about 3 to 4 minutes per side.
Repeat to make 2 more sandwiches, adding more butter as needed.

original_instructions: Place all the ingredients in a blender and process until smooth.
ingredients: 1 medium banana or 1/2 cup frozen strawberries

step_by_step_instructions: Place all the ingredients in a blender.
Process until smooth.

original_instructions:
In a medium saucepot, melt butter over medium-high heat. Add ham, celery, onions, and green peppers. Saute until celery is soft, about 5 minutes.
Add remaining ingredients and stir until rice is evenly distributed. Bring to boil. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes, or until all liquid is absorbed.
ingredients: 1 (14.5-ounce) can diced tomatoes with green peppers, celery, and onion (recommended: Hunt's)
4 dashes hot sauce, or more if needed
1 1/2 cups converted long-grain rice (recommended: Uncle Ben's)

step_by_step_instructions: In a medium saucepot, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add ham, celery, onions, and green peppers.
Saute until celery is soft, about 5 minutes.
Add diced tomatoes, pasta sauce, chicken stock, salt, hot sauce, and rice.
Stir until rice is evenly distributed.
Bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer for 30 minutes, or until all liquid is absorbed.

original_instructions:
In a blender or food processor blend the cream, the vinegar, the mustard, the shallot, the sugar, and the lemon juice until the mixture is combined well, with the motor running add the oil in a stream, and blend the vinaigrette until it is emulsified. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve the vinaigrette over asparagus.
In a blender or food processor blend the cream, the vinegar, the mustard, the shallot, the sugar, and the lemon juice until the mixture is combined well, with the motor running add the oil in a stream, and blend the vinaigrette until it is emulsified. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve the vinaigrette over asparagus.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Dijon-style mustard or to taste
2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste

step_by_step_instructions: In a blender or food processor, blend the cream, vinegar, mustard, shallot, sugar, and lemon juice until the mixture is combined well.
With the motor running, add the oil in a stream and blend the vinaigrette until it is emulsified.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the vinaigrette over asparagus.

recipe_title: Roasted Chicken with Smokey Orange Sauce
original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a large roasting pan with cooking spray.
Season chicken all over with salt and black pepper. Arrange chicken in prepared pan and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine orange marmalade, soy sauce and liquid smoke. Mix until blended. Pour mixture over chicken.
Roast 35 minutes, until chicken is cooked through. Serve 4 chicken breast halves with this meal and refrigerate remaining chicken until ready to use.
Yield: 4 servings (with leftovers for additional meals such as Robin's Chicken Quesadillas and Thai Chicken Salad)

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
Coat a large roasting pan with cooking spray.
Season chicken all over with salt and black pepper.
Arrange chicken in prepared pan and set aside.
In a small bowl, combine orange marmalade, soy sauce, and liquid smoke.
Mix until blended.
Pour mixture over chicken.
Roast for 35 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Serve 4 chicken breast halves and refrigerate remaining chicken.

original_instructions:
Special equipment: 1 large roasting pan
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly coat the roasting pan with vegetable spray.
Make the Vegetables: Toss all of the ingredients in a large bowl, and arrange them in the roasting pan, leaving room in the center for the chicken.
Prepare the Chicken: Nestle the chicken pieces in the center of the pan. Combine the remaining ingredients and sprinkle evenly over the chicken. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour.
Remove the chicken from the oven and baste with the drippings. Continue baking uncovered until well browned, about 1 hour more. Arrange the chicken on a platter surrounded by the vegetables. Sprinkle with the garnish.
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, cored, seeded, and quartered

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Lightly coat the roasting pan with vegetable spray.
Toss celery, squash, zucchini, onion, red bell pepper, garlic, olive oil, salt, oregano, paprika, black pepper, and garlic powder in a large bowl.
Arrange the vegetables in the roasting pan, leaving room in the center for the chicken.
Nestle the chicken pieces in the center of the pan.
Combine salt, paprika, black pepper, poultry seasoning, oregano, garlic powder, and bay leaves, and sprinkle evenly over the chicken.
Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour.
Remove the chicken from the oven and baste with the drippings.
Continue baking uncovered until well browned, about 1 hour more.
Arrange the chicken on a platter surrounded by the vegetables.
Sprinkle with lemon zest and chopped parsley for garnish.

original_instructions:
Peel strings from celery with a Y-shaped vegetable peeler and cut celery into 1/4-inch-thick matchsticks.
Whisk together juice, vinegar, and ginger and stir in celery and remaining ingredients with salt and pepper, to taste. Let stand at room temperature 15 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon finely grated peeled fresh ginger
2 firm Asian pears, cut into 1/4-inch-thick matchsticks
1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh hot red chile, or to taste

step_by_step_instructions: Peel strings from celery using a Y-shaped vegetable peeler.
Cut celery into 1/4-inch-thick matchsticks.
Whisk together lime juice, rice vinegar, and ginger in a bowl.
Stir in celery, Asian pears, scallions, cilantro, and red chile.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Let the mixture stand at room temperature for 15 minutes before serving.

original_instructions:
Melt the chocolate chips and coconut oil together over a double boiler. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or wax paper.
Slice the apple into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Dip the apple slices one at a time into the chocolate, making sure to coat them evenly. The chocolate should go at least three-quarters of the way up each apple slice. Let the excess chocolate drip off.
Press one side of each slice into the peanuts or coconut, and place the slices non-peanut/coconut-side down on the parchment. Place in the fridge or freezer until the chocolate hardens, 10 to 15 minutes. Serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Melt the chocolate chips and coconut oil together over a double boiler.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or wax paper.
Slice the apple into 1/4-inch-thick slices.
Dip the apple slices one at a time into the chocolate, making sure to coat them evenly.
Let the excess chocolate drip off the apple slices.
Press one side of each slice into the peanuts or coconut.
Place the slices non-peanut/coconut-side down on the parchment.
Place in the fridge or freezer until the chocolate hardens, 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve.

original_instructions:
Make the vinaigrette: Stir together the shallot, mustard, honey, vinegar, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste in a bowl. Whisk in the olive oil.
Thinly slice the zucchini and squash lengthwise (with a mandoline, if you have one, or a vegetable peeler), then thinly slice the beets and mushrooms. Drizzle with the vinaigrette and toss. Sprinkle with the chives, chervil and tarragon. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Photograph by Con Poulos
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
1/3 cup chopped fresh chives, chervil and/or tarragon
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Stir together the shallot, mustard, honey, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Whisk in the olive oil to complete the vinaigrette.
Thinly slice the zucchini and squash lengthwise using a mandoline or vegetable peeler.
Thinly slice the beets and mushrooms.
Drizzle the sliced vegetables with the vinaigrette and toss to coat.
Sprinkle the vegetables with chives, chervil, and tarragon.
Season the salad to taste with salt and pepper.

original_instructions:
To Béchamel sauce add Gruyère cheese, Parmesan cheese, and onion. Add salt and pepper to taste. Heat until flavors are thoroughly blended and the sauce is smooth.
To Béchamel sauce add Gruyère cheese, Parmesan cheese, and onion. Add salt and pepper to taste. Heat until flavors are thoroughly blended and the sauce is smooth.

step_by_step_instructions: Add Gruyère cheese to the Béchamel sauce.
Add Parmesan cheese to the Béchamel sauce.
Add onion to the Béchamel sauce.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Heat the mixture until flavors are thoroughly blended and the sauce is smooth.

original_instructions: In a champagne glass pour chilled champagne. Carefully pour peach nectar down the inside of glass. Garnish with peach slice.

step_by_step_instructions: Pour chilled champagne into a champagne glass.
Carefully pour peach nectar down the inside of the glass.
Garnish with a slice of peach.

original_instructions: In a 1 quart microwave proof bowl combine cheese and salsa. Heat in the microwave for 2 minutes on high heat (stirring halfway through) or until cheese is melted and hot. Serve with tortilla chips and red bell pepper spears.
ingredients: Tortilla chips and red bell pepper spears

step_by_step_instructions: Combine cheddar cheese and salsa in a 1 quart microwave-proof bowl.
Heat in the microwave on high for 2 minutes.
Stir halfway through the heating process.
Continue heating until the cheese is melted and the mixture is hot.
Serve with tortilla chips and red bell pepper spears.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Toss the potatoes with the canola oil, garlic paste and salt and pepper to taste. Place on a sheet tray and roast until cooked through and golden brown, 25 to 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and immediately fold in the herbs. Re-season if needed and drizzle with olive oil to finish.
ingredients: 6 to 8 new potatoes, cut in half or quartered, depending on size
2 cloves garlic, smashed and turned into a paste

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
Toss the potatoes with the canola oil, garlic paste, salt, and pepper.
Place the potatoes on a sheet tray and roast in the oven until cooked through and golden brown, approximately 25 to 30 minutes.
Remove the potatoes from the oven and immediately fold in the herbs.
Re-season the potatoes if needed and drizzle with olive oil to finish.

original_instructions:
Combine all of the ingredients in a medium bowl and wrap tightly with plastic wrap. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to overnight.
When ready to cook, form the mixture into small patties about 1/4-inch thick and 3 inches wide. Cook in a skillet over medium-high heat, turning once, until golden brown and completely cooked through, about 8 minutes total. Transfer the sausage to a serving dish and serve warm.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine the ground pork shoulder, maple syrup, dried sage, chopped shallot, Dijon mustard, black pepper, and kosher salt in a medium bowl.
Wrap the mixture tightly with plastic wrap.
Chill the mixture in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to overnight.
When ready to cook, form the mixture into small patties about 1/4-inch thick and 3 inches wide.
Cook the patties in a skillet over medium-high heat, turning once, until golden brown and completely cooked through, about 8 minutes total.
Transfer the cooked sausage patties to a serving dish and serve warm.

original_instructions:
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the noodles and cook as the label directs, then drain. Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until slightly soft, about 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring, until they begin to brown, about 2 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon butter, the chicken, flour, paprika, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring, until the chicken browns, about 3 minutes. Add the chicken broth and Worcestershire sauce and bring to a gentle simmer; cook until thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Continue simmering gently until the chicken is cooked through, about 2 more minutes. Divide the noodles among plates. Top with the chicken mixture, parsley, some sour cream and paprika.
Photograph by Christopher Testani
ingredients: 4 ounces white or cremini mushrooms, sliced (about 2 cups)
1 1/4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into chunks
1 teaspoon paprika, plus more for topping
1 cup fat-free low-sodium chicken or mushroom broth
1/2 cup sour cream, plus more for topping

step_by_step_instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the noodles and cook as the label directs, then drain.
Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the onion and cook until slightly soft, about 2 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring, until they begin to brown, about 2 minutes.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon butter, the chicken, flour, paprika, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Cook, stirring, until the chicken browns, about 3 minutes.
Add the chicken broth and Worcestershire sauce and bring to a gentle simmer; cook until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the sour cream and season with salt and pepper.
Continue simmering gently until the chicken is cooked through, about 2 more minutes.
Divide the noodles among plates.
Top with the chicken mixture, parsley, some sour cream and paprika.

original_instructions:
Cook beans in a 4-quart pot of boiling salted water until just tender, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain in a colander, then immediately toss with honey, zest, and salt in a large bowl.
Cook beans in a 4-quart pot of boiling salted water until just tender, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain in a colander, then immediately toss with honey, zest, and salt in a large bowl.
ingredients: 1 1/4 pounds wax (yellow) or green beans, trimmed
3/4 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest

step_by_step_instructions: Bring a 4-quart pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the trimmed beans to the boiling water.
Cook the beans until just tender, about 6 to 8 minutes.
Drain the beans using a colander.
Immediately toss the drained beans with honey, lemon zest, and salt in a large bowl.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Bring water to a boil in an electric kettle or in the microwave. Meanwhile, place the ground coffee and salt into a French press carafe. Pour the water over the grounds. Place the plunger in the carafe, but do not press down. Brew for 4 minutes, then slowly push the plunger down. Drink immediately or hold in a thermos for up to 3 hours.

step_by_step_instructions: Bring water to a boil in an electric kettle or in the microwave.
Place the ground coffee and salt into a French press carafe.
Pour the boiling water over the coffee grounds.
Place the plunger in the carafe but do not press down.
Brew for 4 minutes.
Slowly push the plunger down.
Drink immediately or hold in a thermos for up to 3 hours.

original_instructions:
Watch how to make this recipe.
Slam the core of the head of lettuce on the counter then twist and remove it. Quarter the head of lettuce lengthwise.
Combine cocktail sauce, hot sauce, lemon juice and zest and mayo. Stir shrimp into dressing and spoon it evenly down over quartered lettuce. Season salads with a little salt and pepper and scatter chives over the salads and serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Slam the core of the head of lettuce on the counter then twist and remove it.
Quarter the head of lettuce lengthwise.
Combine cocktail sauce, hot sauce, lemon juice and zest, and mayonnaise in a bowl.
Stir the small shrimp into the dressing mix.
Spoon the shrimp and dressing mix evenly down over the quartered lettuce.
Season the salads with a little salt and pepper.
Scatter chopped chives over the salads.
Serve the salads.

recipe_title: Baked Salmon with Honey Mustard Sauce
original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with a nonstick silicone liner, and lay the salmon, skin side down, on top. Set aside.
Combine the mayonnaise, mustard, honey and chives in a medium bowl and stir to thoroughly combine. Reserve half of the sauce. Spoon the remaining sauce over the fish, spreading it evenly all over the top and sides of each fillet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast just until the fish is opaque in the center, 7 minutes. Increase the oven to broil. Broil the fish for 6 to 7 minutes, but keep your eye on it to avoid overcooking. Garnish with chives and serve with the reserved sauce.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons finely chopped chives, plus additional for garnish
Kosher salt and freshly ground white pepper

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Line a large baking sheet with a nonstick silicone liner, and lay the salmon, skin side down, on top. Set aside.
Combine the mayonnaise, mustard, honey, and chives in a medium bowl and stir to thoroughly combine.
Reserve half of the sauce.
Spoon the remaining sauce over the fish, spreading it evenly all over the top and sides of each fillet.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast just until the fish is opaque in the center, about 7 minutes.
Increase the oven to broil.
Broil the fish for 6 to 7 minutes, but keep your eye on it to avoid overcooking.
Garnish with chives and serve with the reserved sauce.

original_instructions: Divide the malt liquor between 2 large glasses, followed by the ice cream and bacon.
ingredients: 12 ounces raspberry-flavored malt liquor or wine cooler
4 strips crisp-cooked bacon, very finely minced

step_by_step_instructions: Divide the malt liquor equally between 2 large glasses.
Add the confetti vanilla ice cream to each glass.
Sprinkle the finely minced crisp-cooked bacon on top.

original_instructions:
In a heavy medium saute pan, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium heat. Spread the potatoes in an even layer in the saute pan, pressing down on them slightly with a spatula. Season with salt and pepper and cook until the potatoes begin to brown on the bottom, 6 to 7 minutes, shaking the pan occasionally to prevent sticking. Pour 1 tablespoon of the melted butter over the top of the potatoes.
Place a large plate over the pan and invert the potatoes onto the plate. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pan, slide the potatoes back in, and brown on the other side, about 5 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper and slide onto a platter. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature
8 medium all-purpose potatoes, boiled, peeled and diced small
Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper, to taste

step_by_step_instructions: In a heavy medium saute pan, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium heat.
Spread the potatoes in an even layer in the saute pan, pressing down on them slightly with a spatula.
Season with salt and pepper and cook until the potatoes begin to brown on the bottom, 6 to 7 minutes, shaking the pan occasionally to prevent sticking.
Pour 1 tablespoon of the melted butter over the top of the potatoes.
Place a large plate over the pan and invert the potatoes onto the plate.
Add the remaining 2 tablespoons butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil to the pan, slide the potatoes back in, and brown on the other side, about 5 minutes more.
Season with salt and pepper and slide onto a platter.
Serve immediately.

original_instructions: In a stockpot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, add the oil, garlic and onion. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and saute until the onion gets tender and aromatic, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the tomato paste and stir well. Add the ground beef and cook until browned, stirring frequently and breaking it apart, about 5 minutes. Add the chili powder and cumin and stir until evenly distributed. Stir in the tomato sauce and broth and lower the heat to a simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, 30 minutes. Stir in the barbecue sauce and cook for an additional 10 minutes. Serve hot.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 pound lean ground beef (at least 90 percent lean)

step_by_step_instructions: In a stockpot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat, add the oil, garlic, and onion.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper and sauté until the onion gets tender and aromatic, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and stir well.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned, stirring frequently and breaking it apart, about 5 minutes.
Add the chili powder and cumin and stir until evenly distributed.
Stir in the tomato sauce and broth and lower the heat to a simmer.
Cook, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
Stir in the barbecue sauce and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

original_instructions:
In a medium pot, bring 1 1/3 cups water to a boil. Add the rice, cover and turn the heat to low. Cook until all the water has been absorbed and rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Let cool until warm.
To the pot with the rice, stir in the milk, sugar and salt. Bring to a simmer, turn the heat to low and cook until the mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in the chocolate chips and vanilla and let rest for 5 minutes. Serve warm or cover and cool in refrigerate for at least 1 hour.

step_by_step_instructions: In a medium pot, bring 1 1/3 cups water to a boil.
Add the rice, cover and turn the heat to low.
Cook until all the water has been absorbed and rice is tender, about 15 minutes.
Let cool until warm.
To the pot with the rice, stir in the milk, sugar and salt.
Bring to a simmer, turn the heat to low and cook until the mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat, stir in the chocolate chips and vanilla.
Let rest for 5 minutes.
Serve warm or cover and cool in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.

original_instructions: Cut corn from cobs. Measure out 8 cups of corn in a 10 quart Dutch oven pot. Combine corn and water. Bring to boil and reduce heat. Simmer, covered for 5 minutes. Drain corn. In same Dutch oven combine with corn, red and green peppers and onions. Stir in vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt and black pepper. Bring to a boil. Boil gently, uncovered for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir together cornstarch and 2 tablespoons water. Add this mixture to corn mixture. Cook and stir until slightly thickened and bubbly. Cook for 2 minutes more. Ladle relish into hot sterilized jars leaving 1/2-inch headspace. Remove any air bubbles. Wipe jar rims and adjust lids and rings. Process in hot boiling water canner for 15 minutes.

step_by_step_instructions: Cut corn from cobs.
Measure out 8 cups of corn and place in a 10 quart Dutch oven pot.
Combine corn and water.
Bring to boil and reduce heat.
Simmer, covered for 5 minutes.
Drain corn.
In the same Dutch oven, combine corn, red and green peppers, and onions.
Stir in vinegar, sugar, mustard, salt, and black pepper.
Bring to a boil.
Boil gently, uncovered for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir together cornstarch and 2 tablespoons of water.
Add this mixture to the corn mixture.
Cook and stir until slightly thickened and bubbly.
Cook for 2 minutes more.
Ladle relish into hot sterilized jars leaving 1/2-inch headspace.
Remove any air bubbles.
Wipe jar rims and adjust lids and rings.
Process in hot boiling water canner for 15 minutes.

original_instructions:
Stir juice and sugar in large bowl until sugar dissolves. Add rum, lime juice and vanilla. Pour mixture into shallow baking dish. Freeze until mixture is entirely crystallized, stirring frequently and scraping crystals from around edges, about 5 hours. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Cover and keep frozen.) Using tines of fork, scrape frozen juice mixture to form small flakes. Spoon granita into goblets and serve.
Stir juice and sugar in large bowl until sugar dissolves. Add rum, lime juice and vanilla. Pour mixture into shallow baking dish. Freeze until mixture is entirely crystallized, stirring frequently and scraping crystals from around edges, about 5 hours. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Cover and keep frozen.)
Using tines of fork, scrape frozen juice mixture to form small flakes. Spoon granita into goblets and serve.
ingredients: 3 cups tropical fruit juice blend (such as pineapple-orange-passion fruit)

step_by_step_instructions: Stir juice and sugar in a large bowl until the sugar dissolves.
Add rum, lime juice, and vanilla to the mixture.
Pour the mixture into a shallow baking dish.
Freeze the mixture until it is entirely crystallized, stirring frequently and scraping crystals from around the edges, about 5 hours.
Using the tines of a fork, scrape the frozen juice mixture to form small flakes.
Spoon the granita into goblets and serve.

recipe_title: Bread and Butter Pickles and Pineapple Ginger Relish
original_instructions:
Preheat an indoor grill pan.
Place the pineapple on the hot grill and grill until it gets nice and caramelized on all sides, about 6 to 8 minutes per side. Chop the grilled pineapple and set aside.
In a medium mixing bowl, add the garlic, pickles, ginger, habanero pepper, salt, and pepper, to taste. Add the grilled pineapple and mix together until well combined. This relish can be used on a burger or hot dogs.
ingredients: 1/2 cup bread and butter pickles, chopped
1 habanero pepper, seeded and finely chopped
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat an indoor grill pan.
Place the pineapple on the hot grill and grill until it gets caramelized on all sides, about 6 to 8 minutes per side.
Chop the grilled pineapple and set aside.
In a medium mixing bowl, add the garlic, pickles, ginger, habanero pepper, salt, and pepper to taste.
Add the grilled pineapple and mix together until well combined.

original_instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a small, heavy nonreactive saucepan and cook over moderate heat until syrupy and reduced to a scant 1/4 cup, about 12 minutes. Cool to room temperature.
Combine all ingredients in a small, heavy nonreactive saucepan and cook over moderate heat until syrupy and reduced to a scant 1/4 cup, about 12 minutes.
Cool to room temperature.

step_by_step_instructions: Combine all ingredients in a small, heavy nonreactive saucepan.
Cook over moderate heat until syrupy and reduced to a scant 1/4 cup, about 12 minutes.
Cool the mixture to room temperature.

original_instructions:
Put the chiles in a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish and set aside for stuffing.
Combine the tuna, peas, corn and mayonnaise in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the peppers with the tuna mixture. Place back in the baking dish; they should fit snugly. Pour the pickled carrots and jalapeno juice over the stuffed chiles. Let come to room temperature, then cover and chill for 2 hours or overnight. Serve cold.
ingredients: 8 Anaheim chiles, charred, stemmed and seeded, left whole for stuffing (see Cook's Note)
Two 6-ounce cans albacore tuna in water, drained
1 cup fresh peas (from 1 pound in the shell), or canned or thawed frozen peas
1/2 cup fresh corn kernels (from 1 ear), or canned or thawed frozen corn
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
One 14.1-ounce can carrots in jalapeno pickling juice

step_by_step_instructions: Put the chiles in a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish and set aside for stuffing.
Combine the tuna, peas, corn and mayonnaise in a small bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the peppers with the tuna mixture.
Place the stuffed peppers back in the baking dish; they should fit snugly.
Pour the pickled carrots and jalapeno juice over the stuffed chiles.
Let come to room temperature, then cover and chill for 2 hours or overnight.
Serve cold.

original_instructions:
Pour the milk into a saucepan and scrape in the seeds from the vanilla pod. Add the pod to the pot, too, and judiciously grate in some nutmeg. Heat the milk to the boiling point. Remove from the heat, cover, and let sit 10 minutes to infuse.
Meanwhile, beat the egg yolks and sugar together in a bowl. When the milk has infused, whisk it into the eggs and return the whole thing to the saucepan. Place the pan back on the heat and whisk to thicken slightly, about 3 to 5 minutes. Do not allow the mixture to boil. Stir in the flower water, to taste. Strain the mixture into a jug, cool, and, chill.
ingredients: Orange flower water or rum, to taste

step_by_step_instructions: Pour the milk into a saucepan and scrape in the seeds from the vanilla pod.
Add the vanilla pod to the saucepan.
Grate a pinch of nutmeg into the milk.
Heat the milk to the boiling point.
Remove the saucepan from heat, cover it, and let sit for 10 minutes to infuse.
Meanwhile, beat the egg yolks and sugar together in a bowl.
After the milk has infused, whisk it into the egg mixture.
Return the mixture to the saucepan and place it back on the heat.
Whisk the mixture to thicken slightly for about 3 to 5 minutes without allowing it to boil.
Stir in orange flower water to taste.
Strain the mixture into a jug, cool it, and then chill.

original_instructions:
Peel and slice cucumbers into very thin slices. Sprinkle sliced cucumber slices with salt and let stand a few minutes. Squeeze out excess moisture. Combine vinegar, sugar, and soy in a bowl and mix well. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cucumber slices and mix well. Serve in individual dishes.
May add Wakame (seaweed), crab, and shrimp.
ingredients: 1 large English cucumber, or 2 to 3 Japanese cucumbers

step_by_step_instructions: Peel and slice cucumbers into very thin slices.
Sprinkle sliced cucumber slices with salt and let stand a few minutes.
Squeeze out excess moisture.
Combine vinegar, sugar, and soy sauce in a bowl and mix well.
Pour the vinegar mixture over the cucumber slices and mix well.
Serve in individual dishes. May add Wakame, crab, and shrimp.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
Put the bacon on a sheet tray lined with a wire rack and bake until crisp, about 18 to 22 minutes Remove the bacon from oven, allow to cool and then crumble.
Put the eggs in a small saucepan and cover them with salted water. Bring the water to a boil over medium heat, then cover, and remove the saucepan from the heat. Allow the eggs to sit for 10 minutes. Remove eggs from pan and shock in ice water. Peel the eggs and cut in half. Remove the yolks to a medium-sized bowl. Add the mayonnaise, cayenne, mustard, horseradish, salt, and pepper. Mix until smooth and creamy. Put the mixture into a piping bag. Arrange the egg whites on a serving platter. Pipe a heaping tablespoon of the egg yolk mixture into each of the egg whites. Sprinkle each egg with some bacon and scallions. Serve.

step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
